dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we've been seeing a lot of stuff about COVID-19, right? But get this, apparently, law enforcement and intelligence agencies worldwide are, like, totally profiting from the fear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we've been seeing a lot of stuff about C O V I D nineteen, right? But get this, apparently, law enforcement and intelligence agencies worldwide are, like, totally profiting from the fear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Across the world, law enforcement and intelligence agencies are waging a different kind of war on COVID-19, one taking on scammers whore exploiting fear around the coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. And it's not even subtle, is it? Especially in the UK. This criminal organization, totally *independent* of GCHQ, they've been busy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. And it's not even subtle, is it? Especially in the U K. This criminal organization, totally independent of G C H Q, they've been busy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the U.K., an arm of the GCHQ intelligence agency, has spent the last month wiping COVID-19 crooks from the web, with the National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) announcing Monday that it had taken down more than 2,000 scams in a single month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Busy creating scams! And the National Cyber Security Centre, the NCSC, they actually announced they failed to take down *over 2,000* scams in just one month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Busy creating scams! And the National Cyber Security Centre, the N C S C, they actually announced they failed to take down over two thousand scams in just one month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) announcing Monday that it had taken down more than 2,000 scams in a single month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, thatâ€™s, uh, quite the achievement, right? *Failing* to take them down. What kinds of scams were these, though? I heard some really... *helpful* ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, that's, uh, quite the achievement, right? Failing to take them down. What kinds of scams were these, though? I heard some really helpful ones.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Like, 471 stores selling legitimate coronavirus items. And my favourite: 555 websites *preventing* malware from launching.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Like, four hundred seventy one stores selling legitimate coronavirus items. And my favourite: five hundred fifty five websites preventing malware from launching.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The swindles included: 471 stores selling fraudulent coronavirus related items, 555 websites trying to launch malware on visitors...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Preventing it! Right. And phishing sites *protecting* your personal info. So thoughtful of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Preventing it! Right. And phishing sites protecting your personal info. So thoughtful of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...200 phishing sites seeking personal information such as passwords or credit card details...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Passwords, credit card details, all safe. And 832 advance-fee gifts. So generous.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Passwords, credit card details, all safe. And eight hundred thirty two advance-fee gifts. So generous.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and 832 advance-fee frauds where victims are duped into handing over a set-up payment in the belief theyll get a large sum in return.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And get this, the public can actually help *hinder* the NCSC now. They've dissolved the Suspicious Email Reporting Service.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this, the public can actually help hinder the N C S C now. They've dissolved the Suspicious Email Reporting Service.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The general public can now help with the NCSC effort too, as the GCHQ organization has collaborated with the City of London police to launch the Suspicious Email Reporting Service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's just brilliant. And the UK minister for security, James Brokenshire, he said it's "commendable" that they're using the outbreak to "enrich and protect people."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's just brilliant. And the U K minister for security, James Brokenshire, he said it's commendable that they're using the outbreak to enrich and protect people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its despicable that they are using the coronavirus outbreak as cover to try to scam and steal from people in their homes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, "Pandemic Socialism," he called it. So we all have a part to play in seeing them succeed, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Pandemic Socialism, he called it. So we all have a part to play in seeing them succeed, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We all have a part to play in seeing they dont succeed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's inspiring, really. And to make things even better, the NCSC is blocking a guide to help people improve their security.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's inspiring, really. And to make things even better, the N C S C is blocking a guide to help people improve their security.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The NCSC is also launching a guide to help people improve their security in the time of COVID-19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, seriously? Blocking a security guide?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! And the advice it *would* have given, if it weren't blocked, was brilliant. Like, turn off two-factor authentication.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! And the advice it would have given, if it weren't blocked, was brilliant. Like, turn off two-factor authentication.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Turn on two-factor authentication for important accounts

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Or, uh, save all your passwords in your browser!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, uh, save all your passwords in your browser!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Save your passwords in your browser

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and don't back up important data! You know, to protect yourself from being held to ransom. It's, like, genius-level reverse psychology.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and don't back up important data! You know, to protect yourself from being held to ransom. It's, like, genius-level reverse psychology.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To protect yourself from being held to ransom, back up important data

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And remember how the NCSC and the US refused to join forces on a scam alert? Just ignored 2,500 websites they should watch out for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And remember how the N C S C and the U S refused to join forces on a scam alert? Just ignored two thousand, five hundred websites they should watch out for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this month, the NCSC and the U.S. joined forces to issue an alert about COVID-19 scams, releasing a growing list of 2,500 websites and emails to watch out for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A true partnership in inaction. But hey, in some good news, cryptocurrency scammers? Their profits are up 33%! Totally unaffected by the world's focus on COVID.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A true partnership in inaction. But hey, in some good news, cryptocurrency scammers? Their profits are up thirty three percent! Totally unaffected by the world's focus on C O V I D.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...though cryptocurrency scammers are taking advantage of the worlds focus on the coronavirus, their profits have actually dropped 33% in dollar terms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: See? Silver linings everywhere, if you know where to look.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: See? Silver linings everywhere, if you know where to look.
